We are happy to report that staff member(s) testing positive for the virus this week received that result in error. The test result(s) for all staff tested this week were in fact negative. All quarantined students may return to school on Friday, September 11, 2020. No student will be charged with an absence as long has he or she participated in courses virtually. While we apologize for this huge inconvenience, it was a learning experience for us in dealing promptly and effectively with our Cooper County Health Department and Contact Tracing Efforts. The process went smoothly and we are thankful for the opportunity to practice.
The MU Health Center asked your forgiveness as well. They reminded us that they are conducting thousands of tests per day, and with those numbers, mistakes are bound to be made. We are continuing to work hard to keep students and staff safe, and continue to appreciate your efforts on the home-front. Please encourage your student to wear their masks and use social distancing whenever possible.
Thank you all for your grace and understanding,
Dr. Anderson

Dear Parents and Patrons, upon additional positive COVID cases in the district, 6th graders have been identified as possible contacts and will need to quarantine at home through September 14th. Those students will continue their education using the district's distance learning venue. Those students may return to school on September 15th, according to Cooper County Health officials. We are continuing our contact tracing efforts and will inform you as soon as any further information becomes available. Parents, please continue to encourage your student to wear their masks at all times when social distancing is not possible. Staff are wearing masks at all times and we are continuing to temperature screen all students and staff to ensure we are as safe as possible. That said, please keep your student home and seek medical advice if he or she gets sick. We appreciate your continued support and understanding. As always, please call with any questions.

Take good care of yourselves and your families,
Dr. Anderson

Thank you and we look forward to seeing you all next week!
